Main.TextJPN: 「えぇえぇ、皆さんもご苦労さんなことです。@k@vS05/11/100700392.お暑いでしょうが、せいぜい頑張って下さいよ。@k@vS05/11/100700393.不法投棄のダンプが現れたらすぐにご連絡下さい。@k@vS05/11/100700394.急行いたしますのでね」
Main.TextENG: ``Ehhh, good work, everyone.@k@vS05/11/100700392. I know it's hot, but please do your best.@k@vS05/11/100700393. If you catch anybody illegally dumping, please contact someone immediately.@k@vS05/11/100700394. We'll act quickly.``

Main.TextJPN: 「ご協力、感謝しますよ大石さん。@k@vS05/00/104600051.…どうぞ」
Main.TextENG: ``Thank you for your cooperation, Ooishi-san.@k@vS05/00/104600051. ...Please.``

Main.TextJPN: バリケードに車一台分の隙間が開けられる。
Main.TextENG: A gap wide enough for a single car was opened up in the barricade.

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏は短いクラクションで謝意、あるいは威嚇を示し、車を発進させ検問所を抜け出した。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi, showing his gratitude -- or perhaps a threatening attitude -- with a short beep on the horn, rolled the car forward through the checkpoint.

Main.TextJPN: 今回の自分の姿も不審者そのものだった。
Main.TextENG: This time, my appearance was the very embodiment of the word 'suspicious.'

Main.TextJPN: 野球帽にマスクにサングラス。
Main.TextENG: A baseball cap, mask, and sunglasses.

Main.TextJPN: さらにこの暑いのにフードまで被っているのだから、真っ当な警官なら職質をしたい気持ちをそそられること間違いなしだ。
Main.TextENG: On top of that even though it was sweltering, I was wearing a hoodie. Any respectable police officer would be loathe to not stop me for questioning.

Main.TextJPN: 自分の面が割れていることを充分に警戒しての、過剰な変装のつもりだったが。@k…すでに何の効果もないのかもしれない。
Main.TextENG: I had meant to be overcautious knowing full well that my face was known...@k ...But it might have already been too late for that to have any use.

Main.TextJPN: そういう諦めを言い訳に、暑くて我慢がならなかったフード付きの薄いジャンパーを脱ぎ、マスクや帽子を脱いで後の座席に放った。
Main.TextENG: Using that as an excuse, I doffed the unbearably hot hoodie and windbreaker, ripped off the mask and hat and threw them in the seat behind me.

Main.TextJPN: 「こんな小細工したところで。@k@vS05/13/101300448.どうせ割れているでしょうから」
Main.TextENG: ``With a cheap little disguise like this,@k@vS05/13/101300448. they probably figured it out anyways.``

Main.TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは。@k@vS05/11/100700398.そりゃあまぁそうでしょうなぁ」
Main.TextENG: ``Na ha ha ha.@k@vS05/11/100700398. That just might be the case.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏は、自分のそういう態度が意外で面白かったらしく、しばらく笑い続けていた。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi, probably thinking that my unexpected behavior was funny, continued to laugh.

Main.TextJPN: 雛見沢の、素朴で美しい村の風景がいっぱいに広がる。
Main.TextENG: The beautiful and pristine scenery of Hinamizawa spread out before me.

Main.TextJPN: …この村の複雑な事情さえなかったら、何て美しい村なんだろう。
Main.TextENG: ...The village itself would have been quite beautiful if it weren't for the complicated circumstances surrounding it at the moment.

Main.TextJPN: …ぜひ一度、雪絵を連れてドライブに行きたいな。
Main.TextENG: ...I would absolutely love to take Yukie here for a drive one day.

Main.TextJPN: …そう言えば、昨夜は電話をかけ損ねたな…。
Main.TextENG: ...Come to think of it, I didn't get a chance to call her last night...

Main.TextJPN: ………そんな考えに思考を遊ばせる。
Main.TextENG: ...I played around with the idea in my head.

Main.TextJPN: だが、実際は小春日和のような村ではない。
Main.TextENG: But in reality, this village wasn't all sunshine and rainbows.

Main.TextJPN: 一番初め、県警本部で私は全てを伝えられた。
Main.TextENG: I had heard everything at the prefectural headquarters.

Main.TextJPN: この村の深部、御三家の情報収集力は、血縁や地縁によって信じ難いくらいに固められており、@k雛見沢界隈は愚か、その情報網は鹿骨市全体にまで広がっていると。
Main.TextENG: At the heart of this village, the intelligence network that the Three Families wielded was, due to blood ties and regional relationships, unbelievably well organized.@k Their net spread not just around Hinamizawa itself, but encapsulated the entirety of the city of Shishibone as well.

Main.TextJPN: それを聞いた時、自分は心のどこかでそれを真剣に捉えていなかった。
Main.TextENG: When I first heard that, somewhere in the recesses of my mind I didn't take it completely seriously.

Main.TextJPN: こんな田舎の地域団体が何を大袈裟な。
Main.TextENG: How could a local organization out in the boonies here have something so grandiose?

Main.TextJPN: …心の奥でそう嘲笑って馬鹿にしていたことをもはや否定しない。
Main.TextENG: ...I couldn't deny that somewhere in the back of my mind I had ridiculed the thought.

Main.TextJPN: だが、彼らは実際に大臣脅迫をやってのけただけでなく、極秘で動いてるはずの我々の動きを完全に掌握して見せた。
Main.TextENG: But, not only were they really threatening the Minister, but they had demonstrated they had a complete grasp on our movements, which were supposed to be top secret.

Main.TextJPN: …まるで、スパイ小説に登場するような、秘密警察が跋扈する東欧の小国のように。
Main.TextENG: ...They were almost like the secret police that controlled a small Eastern-European country like in some spy novel.

Main.TextJPN: 村人たちはダム計画と戦うためならどんな血生臭い手段もいとわない。
Main.TextENG: The villagers here wouldn't bat an eye at getting their hands dirty if it meant fighting the dam project.

Main.TextJPN: それもまた県警本部で聞かされたはずだ。
Main.TextENG: I also heard something like that at the prefectural headquarters.

Main.TextJPN: あぁ、…そう言えば、初めてここに来たときに大石氏も、この村のことを戦争地帯だと言っていたじゃないか。
Main.TextENG: Ah... now that you mention it, when I first arrived here, Ooishi also said that this place was a warzone, didn't he?

Main.TextJPN: この村の住民たちは、住民であると同時に郷土解放の戦士でもあるのだ。
Main.TextENG: The residents of this village were at the same time freedom fighters.

Main.TextJPN: 定義的には民兵、ゲリラと変わらない。
Main.TextENG: Although by definition they were no different than guerillas or a militia.

Main.TextJPN: ジュネーブ条約によって保護されないと同時に、彼らもまたそれを遵守しない。
Main.TextENG: They weren't protected by the Geneva Convention, but they also didn't have to adhere to those rules either.

Main.TextJPN: ここでは、合法的な戦場よりもさらにさらに泥沼の、本当の暗闘が繰り広げられている……。
Main.TextENG: This place was more of a quagmire than any legitimate battlefield. A secret war was unfolding...

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏と一緒にいるからドライブをしていられるのであって、@k……自分がこの車を下車して自動販売機でも探しに出掛けたなら、…帰ってこられない可能性だってあるのだ。
Main.TextENG: I could drive along because Ooishi was with me...@k ...but if I was to leave this car for even something as trivial as looking for a vending machine... there was a chance I wouldn't return.

Main.TextJPN: 銃弾が一発も飛ばなくたって、…戦場なのだ。
Main.TextENG: Even though a single shot hadn't been fired... this was a battlefield.

Main.TextJPN: いや、…銃弾が飛ばないのは、日本では民間人の手に銃が渡りにくいからというだけだ。
Main.TextENG: No... the reason why bullets weren't flying was simply because it was hard for a civilian to obtain a gun in Japan.

Main.TextJPN: だから彼らは、銃以外で入手しやすい武器で武装するだろう。
Main.TextENG: So they were probably just equipped with weapons other than guns that were easier to obtain.

Main.TextJPN: だから大石氏は、…あんな防刃ベストを着ているんじゃないか。
Main.TextENG: That was why Ooishi was wearing that stab-proof vest, wasn't it?

Main.TextJPN: 「赤坂さん、緊張してます？@k@vS05/11/100700400.　んっふっふっふ！」
Main.TextENG: ``Akasaka-san, are you nervous?@k@vS05/11/100700400. Nfu fu fu!``

Main.TextJPN: 自分の緊張は当然、大石氏には筒抜けだった。
Main.TextENG: The fact that I was apprehensive was, of course, picked up on by Ooishi.

Main.TextJPN: すでにばれているのなら、無理に否定したり隠したりするのは美徳ではない。
Main.TextENG: If he already figured it out, there was no point in trying to deny or hide it.

Main.TextJPN: 「…もちろんです。@k@vS05/13/101300451.敵の本拠地にたった二人で乗り込んでいるんですよ？@k@vS05/13/101300452.　この人数では万一の時が不安です」
Main.TextENG: ``...Of course I am.@k@vS05/13/101300451. We're headed into the heart of enemy territory alone, aren't we?@k@vS05/13/101300452. I'm worried about if something unlikely happens with just the two of us.``

Main.TextJPN: 「万一の時？@k@vS05/11/100700402.　なっはっはっはっはっは！@k@vS05/11/100700403.　大丈夫ですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Something unlikely?@k@vS05/11/100700402. Na ha ha ha ha ha!@k@vS05/11/100700403. It'll be all right.``

Main.TextJPN: 「この村の人間全てが敵ではありませんでしたか？@k@vS05/13/101300454.　全員が口裏を合わせれば、この村で白昼堂々殺人が起こっても証拠一つ残らない。@k@vS05/13/101300455.そういうところだと聞いていますよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Isn't everybody in this village our enemy?@k@vS05/13/101300454. If everybody gets their stories straight, they could murder someone in broad daylight and there wouldn't be a shred of evidence.@k@vS05/13/101300455. I'm asking about something like that.``

Main.TextJPN: ヤクザの事務所へ単身乗り込むなという鉄則は、つまりはこういうこと。
Main.TextENG: This was what the ironclad rule of not barging into a yakuza office alone was about.

Main.TextJPN: 環境に中立が含まれないとき、その空間は常識的なルールの束縛がない。
Main.TextENG: If there wasn't a neutral party involved, that area wasn't bound by the laws of common sense.

Main.TextJPN: 何があってもそれを証明できないし、味方になってくれる人もいない。
Main.TextENG: If something happened, you wouldn't be able to prove it, and there wasn't anybody who would take your side.

Main.TextJPN: それはつまり、文字通り敵の腹中を指す。
Main.TextENG: It was pretty much the definition of poking the bear.

Main.TextJPN: 「雛見沢地区へ向かうと同僚に言い残してますしね。@k@vS05/11/100700405.万一の時は無線機もありますし。@k@vS05/11/100700406.…赤坂さんが怖がってるほどね、そう簡単には完全犯罪はできませんよ」
Main.TextENG: ``I've left word that we're headed towards the Hinamizawa area.@k@vS05/11/100700405. And in the worst case, we've also got a radio.@k@vS05/11/100700406. I know you're scared, Akasaka-san, but it's not that easy to pull off the perfect crime.

Main.TextJPN: 「…まぁ、もちろん油断をしないに越したことはありませんがねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ...Well, of course that doesn't mean we can let our guard down, either.``

Main.TextJPN: 「赤坂さん、緊張しすぎですよ。@k@vS05/11/100700409.前にご一緒してた時の方がリラックスしてらしたじゃないですか。@k@vS05/11/100700410.なっはっはっはっは…」
Main.TextENG: ``Akasaka-san, you're too worked up over this.@k@vS05/11/100700409. You were more relaxed the last time we came up here together, weren't you?@k@vS05/11/100700410. Na ha ha ha ha...``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏は笑い飛ばすように大笑いすると、自分を頼れと言わんばかりに胸板を叩いて、にやっと笑って見せた。
Main.TextENG: Laughing it off, Ooishi thumped his chest and grinned, as if to say I could depend on him.

Main.TextJPN: 「まぁ、本当の本当にやばくなったら、なはははは！@k@vS05/11/100700412.　桜の代紋にはこいつがありますからねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, if it gets really iffy, nahahaha!@k@vS05/11/100700412. This comes with having the badge.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏が人差し指を突き出す仕草をしてみせる。@k…拳銃をイメージしたものに違いない。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi made a motion by sticking out his index finger.@k ...It was undoubtedly the image of a gun.

Main.TextJPN: 「…役に立ちますか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Will it be of any use?``

Main.TextJPN: 「撃った後の後始末云々が怖くなければ、実に心強いですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``If you're not afraid of dealing with the aftermath after you shoot, it's actually very reassuring.``

Main.TextJPN: 警官の鉄砲なんて、ただ見せびらかすだけ。
Main.TextENG: An officer's gun was only for show.

Main.TextJPN: 本当に発射するには、相当の規定のクリアと、その後に待ち構える長い長い後始末の苦行に耐える覚悟が必要だ。
Main.TextENG: If you really wanted to fire it, there were quite a number of stipulations, and you had to be prepared for the long probationary period afterwards.

Main.TextJPN: そんなの、絶対に割りにあわないから、警官は銃を抜くことはあっても、引き金を引きたいなんて心底は思わない。
Main.TextENG: That definitely wasn't worth it, so even if an officer did unholster his gun, there wasn't one who actually wanted to pull the trigger.

Main.TextJPN: 「赤坂さんは持ってるんですか？@k@vS05/11/100700415.　『コレ』」
Main.TextENG: ``Akasaka-san, are you carrying one?@k@vS05/11/100700415. One of these.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…まぁ、一応」
Main.TextENG: ``...Well, yeah.``

Main.TextJPN: 「撃ったことは？」
Main.TextENG: ``You ever fired it?``
``I have.@k@vS05/13/101300460. ...For training, though.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そりゃあそうでしょうなぁ。@k@vS05/11/100700418.んっふっふっふ…！」
Main.TextENG: ``Well I guess that'd be true.@k@vS05/11/100700418. Nfu fu fu...!``

Main.TextJPN: 「なら大石さんにはあるんですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``Well then, have you, Ooishi-san?``

Main.TextJPN: 「私ですか？@k@vS05/11/100700420.　なっはははは！@k@vS05/11/100700421.　まぁさかぁ、あるわけないじゃないですか」
Main.TextENG: ``Me?@k@vS05/11/100700420. Naahahahaha!@k@vS05/11/100700421. Nawww, there's no way.``

Main.TextJPN: 何だ何だ、人のことを笑うから経験があるかと思ったら！@k　二人して笑い合う。
Main.TextENG: What was this? I thought he was laughing at me because he had experience!@k The two of us laughed together.

Main.TextJPN: 「銃口を向けたこともありませんがね。@k@vS05/11/100700423.銃口を向けられたことなら何度かありますよ。@k@vS05/11/100700424.…銃口を覗かされるだけで、寿命が３年は縮むなぁ」
Main.TextENG: ``I've also never pointed the barrel at anybody.@k@vS05/11/100700423. I've looked down the barrel of a gun a few times though.@k@vS05/11/100700424. ...Just being made to look down the barrel like that is enough to shorten your lifespan by about three years.``

Main.TextJPN: たとえ銃を撃ったことがなくても。
Main.TextENG: Even if he had never fired a gun before,

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏が踏んできた場数には、自分が及ぶはずもない。
Main.TextENG: you couldn't even begin to compare the amount of experience Ooishi had over me.

Main.TextJPN: …この時になって、今さらのように、私は大石氏を頼もしいと思った。
Main.TextENG: ...At a time like this, I could only marvel again at how reliable Ooishi seemed.

Main.TextJPN: 「……そう言えば、日の高い内にこっちには来たくなかったなぁ。@k@vS05/11/100700426.でも車道はここ抜ける以外にないし。@k@vS05/11/100700427.…赤坂さん、念のため、もう一回マスクで顔を隠してください」
Main.TextENG: ``...Come to think of it, I didn't want to come this way in the middle of the day.@k@vS05/11/100700426. But there's no way for a car to get through other than here.@k@vS05/11/100700427. ...Akasaka-san, just in case, put on the mask again to hide your face, please.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…どうしたんです？」
Main.TextENG: ``...What's the matter?``

Main.TextJPN: 「冷房がうるさいから聞こえないかな？@k@vS05/11/100700429.　切りますよ。@k@vS05/11/100700430.窓を開けてみて下さい」
Main.TextENG: ``Can you not hear it because the air conditioning is too loud?@k@vS05/11/100700429. I'll turn it off.@k@vS05/11/100700430. Try opening the window.``

Main.TextJPN: 窓を開けると、ぶわっとした熱気の風が吹き込んでくる。
Main.TextENG: When I opened the window, a blast of hot air blew inside.

Main.TextJPN: そして…、…遠くから聞こえてくるその怒号が耳に入った。
Main.TextENG: And then... I could hear angry yelling coming from far away.

Main.TextJPN: その時、一斉に左右の森が開け、一気に視界が広がる。
Main.TextENG: At that moment, the forest gave way on either side of us, and our view expanded suddenly.

Main.TextJPN: …そこは、雛見沢ダム建設現場。@k…そう、雛見沢村の、最前線だった。
Main.TextENG: ...And there could be seen the Hinamizawa Dam Construction Grounds.@k ...The very front line for Hinamizawa Village.

Main.TextJPN: 「雛見沢ダム建設、絶対反対ッ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``````We're absolutely opposed to the construction of the Hinamizawa Dam!!``````

Main.TextJPN: 巨大な拡声器から割れた爆音のような大音声が吐き出される。
Main.TextENG: The crackling blare of someone's voice sounded over an enormous loudspeaker.

Main.TextJPN: 群集が一斉に地面を踏み鳴らすような怒号がそれに続いて唸りを上げた。
Main.TextENG: The roar of angry voices continued to rumble.

Main.TextJPN: その凄まじい音量はまさに音の大砲となって、弾丸を吐き出すようだった。
Main.TextENG: The incredible volume had become a veritable sound cannon, spewing out its ammunition.

Main.TextJPN: ダムの現場事務所のプレハブ群は、二重の高い柵に覆われ、さらに有刺鉄線まで巻かれている。
Main.TextENG: The prefabricated site office was surrounded by two sets of high fences laced with barbed wire.

Main.TextJPN: そしてその柵の前にはズラリと機動隊の隊員とその車両が並ぶ。
Main.TextENG: Lined up in front of those fences were riot police and their vehicles.

Main.TextJPN: そして、それを取り囲む村人たち。
Main.TextENG: And surrounding it all were the villagers.

Main.TextJPN: 彼らは全員でひとつの生き物であるかのように、ダム反対アピールを口を揃えて吠え立てた。
Main.TextENG: They howled out their protests against the dam as a single entity.

Main.TextJPN: 「お、…今日は少ないですね。@k@vS05/11/100700432.ツイてます」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh... there's not too many of them today.@k@vS05/11/100700432. We're in luck.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…少ないんですか」
Main.TextENG: ``...That's not too many?``

Main.TextJPN: 「えぇ、多い時だと、道路までいっぱいになりますよ。@k@vS05/11/100700434.おちおち車も通れません」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah, when there's a lot of them, the crowd reaches as far as the road.@k@vS05/11/100700434. You wouldn't even be able to inch forward in a car.``

Main.TextJPN: 初めのすごい迫力のせいで、人数を過大に見てしまったが、確かに人数はせいぜい５０人～７０人くらいだろう。
Main.TextENG: At first, due to their overwhelming intensity, it looked to me like there was more people than there actually was, but upon closer inspection there were at most 50 to 70 of them.

Main.TextJPN: だが６台～７台の暴力団紛いの街宣車をずらりと並べ、その陣容は充分に異様だ。
Main.TextENG: But the six or seven propaganda trucks lined up that looked like they belonged to a band of thugs were a strange enough sight.

Main.TextJPN: 村人たちもヘルメットや頬かむり、マスクで顔を覆い、さらにその異様さを煽った。
Main.TextENG: The villagers were also wearing helmets and bandanas, as well as covering their faces with masks, adding to the oddity of it all.

Main.TextJPN: 街宣車の巨大スピーカーはシュプレヒコールを徹底的に浴びせかけた後、さらにさらにボリュームを大きくし、今度はお経を流し始める。
Main.TextENG: The propaganda trucks, after braying their chorus, had their volume turned up even higher and began to flood the area with sutras.

Main.TextJPN: その音の暴力といったら、…たとえようもない。
Main.TextENG: To say that the noise was downright violent wouldn't be an understatement.

Main.TextJPN: この距離でこれだけの音量なのだから、…きっと事務所の中はガラスがびりびり言うくらいに響いているだろう。
Main.TextENG: From this distance it was still this loud... the glass in the office was probably rattling from the noise.

Main.TextJPN: 「あれをガンガンやられるとたまんないんですよねぇ。@k@vS05/11/100700436.機動の連中、全員、耳栓してて、それでも耳がおかしくなるそうです。@k@vS05/11/100700437.気の毒な話です」
Main.TextENG: ``They can't do anything there but take it.@k@vS05/11/100700436. Those riot squad guys, every one of them is wearing earplugs, but they're still having their hearing damaged.@k@vS05/11/100700437. Poor sobs.``

Main.TextJPN: 「騒音規制で何とかできないんですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``Can't you do something about it with noise ordinance laws?``

Main.TextJPN: 「ん～～～～、うちの県には騒音規制に関する規定ね、ないんですよ。@k@vS05/11/100700439.それにほら、お経でしょ？@k@vS05/11/100700440.　宗教活動規制できないし。@k@vS05/11/100700441.連中も頭いいんです。@k@vS05/11/100700442.なっはっはっは…」
Main.TextENG: ``Hmmm... our prefecture doesn't have any laws regarding noise ordinance.@k@vS05/11/100700439. Also, those are sutras, right?@k@vS05/11/100700440. We can't regulate religious activities.@k@vS05/11/100700441. Those guys are pretty smart.@k@vS05/11/100700442. Na ha ha ha...``

Main.TextJPN: と、大石氏は言ったのだと思う。
Main.TextENG: Is what I think Ooishi said.

Main.TextJPN: 実際のところ、どんなにびったり窓ガラスを閉めても爆音のようなお経が車内を満たす。
Main.TextENG: Actually, no matter how tightly the window was shut, the booming sound of the sutras still filled the car.

Main.TextJPN: 隣に座っているはずの大石氏の会話ですら、何を言ってるか聞き取れなかった。
Main.TextENG: I couldn't even hear what Ooishi, who was sitting right next to me, was saying.

Main.TextJPN: 車が街宣車の車列に近付くに従い、爆音が耐え難いものになっていく。
Main.TextENG: As the car approached the line of propaganda trucks, the blare became difficult to bear.

Main.TextJPN: …しまいには指で耳を塞ぐどころか、頭を抱えて頭蓋骨が割れないようにしっかりと押さえる必要があった……。
Main.TextENG: ...It wasn't enough to just plug my ears with my fingers, I had to hold my head to keep my skull from splitting apart...

Main.TextJPN: この、恐ろしいエネルギーをもっと早くに見ていたなら、私は雛見沢村というものをもっと早く理解できたかもしれない。
Main.TextENG: If I had seen this terrifying energy sooner, I would have probably understood what Hinamizawa Village was much quicker.

Main.TextJPN: 今なら分かる。自分たちの郷里を守るためなら、何をすることもいとわないという決死の覚悟がよく分かる。
Main.TextENG: Now I knew. They wouldn't blink an eye at sacrificing themselves in order to protect their home town.

Main.TextJPN: ああぁ、うるさいうるさい、…黙れ黙れ黙れ…！！！
Main.TextENG: Ahhh, so goddamn noisy... shut up shut up shut up...!!!

Main.TextJPN: 頭がガンガンして割れそうで、鼓膜がビリビリして、その上、吐き気までしてきた。
Main.TextENG: My head throbbed and felt like it was going to split apart, my eardrums crackled, and on top of it all, I felt like I was going to throw up.

Main.TextJPN: 道は、村人たち群衆の座り込みと街宣車の車列、そして機動隊の列とその車両で、通り抜けるのは本当に容易ではない。
Main.TextENG: With the road crowded with the throng of squatters, the propaganda trucks, and the riot police's vehicles, it was in no way easy to get by.

Main.TextJPN: 座り込みの人たちをクラクションで追っ払おうにも、@k彼ら自身も耳栓により外界の音を聞いていないので、なかなかどいてくれず、車は牛が歩くような速度でしか進めない。
Main.TextENG: Even if you tried to shoo the squatters with the car horn,@k they were also wearing earplugs, oblivious to noises from the outside world, and wouldn't easily move. The car could only inch forward at a snail's pace.

Main.TextJPN: …それでもなんとか車はそれを抜け、ようやく喧騒から抜け出すことができた。
Main.TextENG: ...Even then, the car eventually got through, starting to leave the tumultuous noise behind.

Main.TextJPN: 「…ほら、昨日、一緒に麻雀やったメンツに、お年寄りさんいたでしょ。@k@vS05/11/100700444.覚えてます？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Hey, the old guy that was playing mahjong with us last night?@k@vS05/11/100700444. Remember him?``

Main.TextJPN: 言葉遣いのあまりよくない老人がいたことを思い出す。
Main.TextENG: I remembered that there was an older person who didn't exactly mince words.

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏が、おやっさんと呼んでいた人物だ。
Main.TextENG: The guy that Ooishi called ``ol' man.``

Main.TextJPN: 「いらっしゃいましたね」
Main.TextENG: ``There was someone like that.``

Main.TextJPN: 「彼ね、第１工区の現場監督さんなんですよ。@k@vS05/11/100700446.あそこのプレハブの中で、いらいらしながら仕事をなさってるんでしょうねぇ。@k@vS05/11/100700447.…お気の毒なことです」
Main.TextENG: ``You see, he's the foreman of the main construction site.@k@vS05/11/100700446. He's probably holed up in that prefab building, trying to work while irritated out of his mind.@k@vS05/11/100700447. ...Poor fella.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…あれが毎日では、たまったものではないでしょう」
Main.TextENG: ``...You wouldn't be able to stand it if it's like that every day.``

Main.TextJPN: 「えぇ。@k@vS05/11/100700449.耐えかねてやめちゃう人が後を絶ちません。@k@vS05/11/100700450.まぁその度にお給金がアップしてるんで、何とも言えませんが。@k@vS05/11/100700451.んっふっふっふ…！」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS05/11/100700449. There's no end to the number of people who can't handle it and quit.@k@vS05/11/100700450. But every time that happens, their wages go up, so I won't say it's in vain.@k@vS05/11/100700451. Nfu fu fu...!``

Main.TextJPN: あれだけの騒音や敵意と差し引いても大石氏が羨むような給金も、少し納得だった。
Main.TextENG: Even having to deal with all that noise and hostility, they still made a wage that Ooishi found enviable.

Main.TextJPN: 「ちっくしょう、こいつら…。@k@vS05/11/100700453.聞こえてるのか聞こえてないのか…」
Main.TextENG: ``Dammit, these guys...@k@vS05/11/100700453. Can they hear or can't they?``

Main.TextJPN: 車の前を、座り込んだ一団が塞いでいた。
Main.TextENG: A group of squatters were in the way of the car.

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏がいらつきながら、クラクションを思い切り鳴らすが、一向にどく様子はない。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi, sufficiently annoyed, laid into the horn. But there was no indication that they were moving any time soon.

Main.TextJPN: この騒音の中、クラクションを鳴らしても聞こえないのか。
Main.TextENG: In this din, could they not even hear a car horn?

Main.TextJPN: それとも聞こえていて意地悪をしているのかはわからないが。
Main.TextENG: Or did they hear it, and were being malicious?

Main.TextJPN: 近くに機動隊員が居れば、気を利かせて人々をどけてくれるのだが、たまたまこの近くにはいないようだった。
Main.TextENG: If there were any riot police nearby, they would have made people move, but it just so happened there weren't any around here.
``....Ah~~~ geez.@k@vS05/11/100700455. Wait just a minute.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏が車の扉を開けた。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi opened up the door.

Main.TextJPN: 熱気とそれ以上の轟音が車内に飛び込んでくる。
Main.TextENG: The hot air and even more heated roar of the crowd spilled into the car.

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏がにやっと笑いながら何か言ったが、私には聞き取ることができなかった。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi said something as he grinned widely, but I couldn't hear what it was.

Main.TextJPN: 連中をちょいとどかしてきます。@k…そんなところだろうか？
Main.TextENG: He was getting them to move.@k ...Something like that?

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏は車を降り、扉を閉める。@k轟音は少し遮られた。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi stepped out of the car and closed the door.@k The din faded slightly.

Main.TextJPN: 私は大石氏が座り込んでいる人々のところへ言って、何やらやりとりをしているのを、呆然と見ていた。
Main.TextENG: I stared blankly as Ooishi headed towards the group and started some sort of conversation.

Main.TextJPN: …高津戸地区で、大臣の孫を見つけられるだろうか。
Main.TextENG: ...Maybe we'd find the minister's grandson at Takatsudo.

Main.TextJPN: 見つけたい。
Main.TextENG: At the very least, I wanted to find him there.

Main.TextJPN: 見つけて、この何だかよくわからない村の呪縛から早く解き放たれたい。
Main.TextENG: Find him, and slip the cursed bonds of this incomprehensible village.

Main.TextJPN: そう願わずにはいられなかった。
Main.TextENG: I could only pray.

Main.TextJPN: その時、ふっと影になった。
Main.TextENG: At that moment, a shadow was suddenly cast over me.

Main.TextJPN: 人影が助手席の窓のすぐ外に立ち、日の光を遮ったからだ。
Main.TextENG: Somebody was standing right outside the passenger-side window, blocking the sunlight.

Main.TextJPN: ふと、…振り向き、……逆光のその人影が誰か気付く。
Main.TextENG: I spun around... looked up... and realized who the backlit figure was.

Main.TextJPN: それは…少女。@k……古手、梨花だった。
Main.TextENG: It was... a girl.@k It was Rika Furude.

Main.TextJPN: 少女は、私をじっと、退屈そうな眼差しで見下ろしていた。
Main.TextENG: The girl stared down at me with a bored look in her eyes.

Main.TextJPN: 何の根拠もなく、…私は見つかってはいけない人に見つかってしまったような、そんな気持ちにさせられる。
Main.TextENG: I didn't have any justification for it, but I felt like I had been found by somebody I shouldn't be found by.

Main.TextJPN: …私は沈黙を埋めるため、やぁと曖昧に応えながら手を上げた。
Main.TextENG: ...To fill the silence, I raised my hand as I mouthed a meek greeting.

Main.TextJPN: もちろん、この轟音の中で私の小声が彼女に伝わるわけもない。
Main.TextENG: Of course, there was no way she heard my small voice in this clamor.

Main.TextJPN: だが、それでも、私が挨拶の意味を込めて手を振ったのは見えるはずだ。
Main.TextENG: But even then, she should have seen me wave my hand in greeting.

Main.TextJPN: にもかかわらず少女は。
Main.TextENG: In spite of that...

Main.TextJPN: …私のことを、無感情そうにただただじっと、見下ろしていた…。
Main.TextENG: She simply stared down at me with a cold look on her face.

Main.TextJPN: その時、再びむわっとした熱気と轟音が車内を満たす。
Main.TextENG: At that moment, the noise and heat spread throughout the car once again.

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏が運転席に戻ってきたのだった。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi had returned to the driver's seat.

Main.TextJPN: 見れば、さっきまで道を塞いでいた一団は、恨めしそうにこっちを見ながら、道を開けてくれているところだった。
Main.TextENG: Taking a look, the group that were blocking the road had started to move aside while glaring our way.
``Sorry to keep you waiting.@k@vS05/11/100700458. Shall we go?@k@vS05/11/100700459. ...Hm?``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏が私越しに、少女の姿を認める。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi registered the figure of the girl behind me.

Main.TextJPN: 村人が一人こちらに駆けて来て、少女を抱きかかえた。
Main.TextENG: One of the villagers came over and picked her up.

Main.TextJPN: 危ないから離れて…というような感じで。
Main.TextENG: In a manner of 'It's dangerous, so get away.'

Main.TextJPN: その時、少女は一言二言、何かを呟いたようだったが、私にはまったく聞き取ることはできない。
Main.TextENG: It was then that she whispered one or two words--however, I couldn't hear any of it.

Main.TextJPN: 「さぁて、行きましょうかね。@k@vS05/11/100700461.飛ばしますよぅ？@k@vS05/11/100700462.　もちろん法定速度遵守で」
Main.TextENG: ``Well then, let's go.@k@vS05/11/100700461. I'm going to gun it, okay?@k@vS05/11/100700462. But of course, still within the speed limit.``

Main.TextJPN: まだ聞こえる怒号を吹っ切るように、大石氏がグンとアクセルを吹かす。
Main.TextENG: As if to shake off the still-audible angry voices, Ooishi floored the gas.

Main.TextJPN: 轟音と怒声の喧騒と、村人たちと少女の姿が見る見るうちに後方から消えていく。
Main.TextENG: Along with the roar and the din and the shouting, the villagers and the girl quickly disappeared behind us.

Main.TextJPN: 「この先を抜けると高津戸地区です。@k@vS05/11/100700464.銃撃戦の覚悟は大丈夫ですか？@k@vS05/11/100700465.　安全装置外すの、土壇場でトチらないでくださいよ？@k@vS05/11/100700466.　んっふっふっふ！」
Main.TextENG: ``As soon as we're through here, we're in Takatsudo.@k@vS05/11/100700464. Are you okay if we end up getting into a firefight?@k@vS05/11/100700465. Don't be fumbling with the safety at the last moment, you hear?@k@vS05/11/100700466. Nfu fu fu!``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏はからかうように笑った。
Main.TextENG: Ooishi laughed mockingly again.

Main.TextJPN: …私はそんなことより、…さっき少女が何を口にしたのかが、漠然と気になって仕方なかった。
Main.TextENG: ...I was more concerned with what the girl had said, however, as I was vaguely bothered by it.

Main.TextJPN: ……無感情な、淡白な、そんな表情で彼女は何と言おうとしたのだろう？
Main.TextENG: ...What was she trying to say with that apathetic and candid expression?

Main.TextJPN: 「今から緊張したって仕方ないですよ。@k@vS05/11/100700468.むしろ、収穫がなくて勇み足って可能性だって充分にあるんですから」
Main.TextENG: ``Suppose it's normal if you're nervous from here on out.@k@vS05/11/100700468. But if you don't deal with it, there's a chance you might do something rash.``

Main.TextJPN: …少女が何を言おうとしたのか、もう確かめようはないのだけれど。
Main.TextENG: ...But there was no longer a way to confirm what the girl had tried to tell me.

Main.TextJPN: かつて、私に東京へ帰れ、さもなければ…と警告した少女。
Main.TextENG: It might have been that the girl who warned me to go back to Tokyo again, or else...

Main.TextJPN: …帰れと警告された私は、その警告に従わず、今もここにいる。
Main.TextENG: Was saying to me who was here now, ignoring that warning...

Main.TextJPN: 「…警告したのに。…ばかなヤツ」
Main.TextENG: ``...Even though I warned you. ...What a fool.``

Main.TextJPN: そんな風に言われたような気がした。
Main.TextENG: I had the feeling she said something like that.
